title: How to Subtly Flirt with a Guy Online

steps.title: Let the guy know you're paying attention to his social media.
steps.content: Let the guy know you're paying attention to his social media. If you just like 1 of his photos, he probably won't read into it. However, if you like most of his recent posts, he'll probably get the idea that you're into him. [1] X Research source If you go back and like his really old posts, it'll be pretty obvious that you're into him—liking recent content is more subtle. This applies to any social media platform he's on. See if he's on Snapchat, Tik Tok, Facebook, etc., and like his content there.

steps.title: Don't wait around for him to chat!
steps.content: Don't wait around for him to chat! Guys can be notoriously oblivious when it comes to flirting. Don't be afraid to make the first move yourself and start flirting with him! [2] X Expert Source Shana Tibi Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. Send him a DM on social media or text him to get the ball rolling. A DM is a great way to signal your interest since it's completely private. You're basically making a personal online space for just the two of you. [3] X Research source He might be pleasantly surprised to see you start an online conversation—this is a great way to show him you're interested. Reader Poll: We asked 320 wikiHow readers how they prefer to slide into a guy’s DMs, and 56% of them agreed that the most effective method is responding to his story with an emoji or quick reaction. [Take Poll] Try it out on Instagram!

steps.title: Skip a boring greeting and ask a thoughtful, quirky question.
steps.content: Skip a boring greeting and ask a thoughtful, quirky question. Part of flirting is just trying to stand out, so don't message him and say something dull like, "Hey," or, "Hi." Catch his attention by pointing out something unique or asking him something silly. [4] X Research source For instance, send him an extreme close-up photo and ask him what he thinks it is. This is a creative way to start a conversation. You could also message him something funny like, "I am so torn—ice cream or sushi for dinner?" Message him to say he's on your mind. You could say, "You'll never guess which song just came on the radio! Remember doing karaoke?" You can also suggest things. For instance, say, "I just finished the best book—you'd probably like it. Want to come borrow it?"

steps.title: Add an emoji or two to break up text and make it lighthearted.
steps.content: Add an emoji or two to break up text and make it lighthearted. [5] X Expert Source Shana Tibi Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. Skip the obvious hearts and lips emojis and stick with more subtle ones—think a winking face, smirking face, or crazy face. [6] X Research source For instance, if you've just teased him and want to lighten the mood so he doesn't take it seriously, add a winking face or a face blowing a kiss emoji. Keep in mind that emojis are pretty subjective, so your crush might not realize that you're flirting unless you also send some flirty texts along with it.

steps.title: Send messages with push-pull to show you're comfortable with him.
steps.content: Send messages with push-pull to show you're comfortable with him. A little teasing signals that you're fun, you don't take yourself too seriously, and that you want to play! [7] X Research source For example, if you've asked whether he likes milk or dark chocolate and he says he doesn't like chocolate, say, "And there I had thought you were too good to be true. Oh well, we can work on that."

steps.title: This is a great way to signal that he's important to you.
steps.content: This is a great way to signal that he's important to you. After all, you want to know what he thinks about something, right? You might say something like, "I've been trying to find some new music. Do you have any recommendations?" or "What did you think about that new restaurant?" [8] X Research source If you're feeling confident and a little bold, you could ask his opinion and then suggest an activity together. For instance, after asking him about a restaurant say, "We should check it out sometime."

steps.title: If you're on a group chat with a crush, mention him by name.
steps.content: If you're on a group chat with a crush, mention him by name. Bring attention back to him if the group's moving on and talking about something else. This shows him that you're paying attention to him and that you care what he thinks. [9] X Research source For instance, if he asks if anybody's seen the latest hit movie, but the conversation skips over this, bring it back! Once there's a slight gap in conversation, say, "Jamal, what were you saying about that movie?"

steps.title: Compliment him on his personality or something he does.
steps.content: Compliment him on his personality or something he does. [10] X Expert Source Shana Tibi Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. This is more meaningful than simply complimenting his looks. By keying in on who he is rather than just what he looks like, he'll realize that you're paying attention to him. [11] X Research source For instance, say, "You're really easy to talk to, Patrick," or, "I love how you always know what's going on in the world."

steps.title: This creates a psychological connection.
steps.content: This creates a psychological connection. Most people can't help it—we like it when someone calls us by name! Whether you're messaging each other or you're just leaving a comment, make a point of using his name at least 1 or twice. If he has a nickname, use that since it suggests that you're comfortable and friendly with each other. [12] X Research source You could say, "Rhys, what are you up to tomorrow?" or, "This is an amazing photo, Mateo."

steps.title: If he's messaged you, reply within a few hours.
steps.content: If he's messaged you, reply within a few hours. If you wait days to message him back, he might get the idea that you don't like him or simply aren't interested in him. To let him know that you do care, it's perfectly fine to reply within a few minutes or at least within a few hours. This is especially true if you're having an online conversation in real-time.

steps.title: While these have a place in online dating, they're not very subtle.
steps.content: While these have a place in online dating, they're not very subtle. If you're trying to flirt with a shy guy, sexting or nude photos might make him feel pressured or uncomfortable. Until you're more comfortable with each other or openly flirting, skip the revealing messages. Plus, you should only send revealing texts or pics to people you completely trust. It's easy for that data to be shared or to get into the wrong hands and you don't want to compromise yourself.
